intro: Carum nudum, commonly known as the naked caraway, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of theApiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent. Carum nudum is often found in coastal and arid regions, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
